result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Maurice Schiessel

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael Maurice Schiessel in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Michael Maurice Schiessel.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Lukas Jaeger, under the student practice rule, appeared with A.D.A. for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Final pretrial conference held.  Parties remain in trial posture. State put their offer on the record which was rejected by the defendant.  Jury trial remains scheduled on 11/07/22 in Branch 1.

Defendant Michael Maurice Schiessel not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes appeared by video for Michael Maurice Schiessel.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Fuentes requests a final pretrial and a speedy trial date.  Court orders any pretrial documents be filed no later than 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Case is adjourned to Br. 1.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with M.E.C.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Upon given pre-trial conference date defense motion to expediate to trial argued as per statue 970.02 (3) and DENIED by the Court.
This hearing may be streamed live at the Court's discretion on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527 
Pretrial Conference set for September 19, 2022 at 8:30AM in Branch 1.

Defendant Michael Maurice Schiessel appeared by video, in custody at MSDF.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes appeared by video for Michael Maurice Schiessel. Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued. MCSO did not provide executed warrant at time of scheduling.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Michael Maurice Schiessel not in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/13/2022@2:00pm
